welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js v10 documentation. v10 is just a more consistent and stable iteration over v9, and contains loads of new and improved features, optimisations, and bug fixes. ## About discord.js is a powerful node.js module that allows you to interact with the [Discord API](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/intro) very easily. - Object-oriented - Predictable abstractions - Performant - Nearly 100% coverage of the Discord API ## Installation **Node.js 6.0.0 or newer is required.** Ignore any warnings about unmet peer dependencies - all of them are optional. Without voice support: `npm install discord.js --save` With voice support ([node-opus](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-opus)): `npm install discord.js node-opus --save` With voice support ([opusscript](https://www.npmjs.com/package/opusscript)): `npm install discord.js opusscript --save` ### Audio engines The preferred audio engine is node-opus, as it performs significantly better than opusscript. When both are available, discord.js will automatically choose node-opus. Using opusscript is only recommended for development environments where node-opus is tough to get working. For production bots, using node-opus should be considered a necessity, especially if they're going to be running on multiple servers. ### Optional packages - [uws](https://www.npmjs.com/package/uws) for much a much faster WebSocket connection (`npm install uws --save`) - [erlpack](https://github.com/hammerandchisel/erlpack) for significantly faster WebSocket data (de)serialisation (`npm install hammerandchisel/erlpack --save`) ## Web distributions Web builds of discord.js that are fully capable of running in browsers are available [here](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js/tree/webpack). These are built by [Webpack 2](https://webpack.js.org/). The API is identical, but rather than using `require('discord.js')`, the entire `Discord` object is available as a global (on the `window` object). The ShardingManager and any voice-related functionality is unavailable in these builds. ## Guides * [LuckyEvie's general guide](https://eslachance.gitbooks.io/discord-js-bot-guide/content/) * [York's v9 upgrade guide](https://yorkaargh.wordpress.com/2016/09/03/updating-discord-js-bots/) ## Links * [Website](https://discord.js.org/) * [Discord.js server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9) * [Discord API server](https://discord.gg/rV4BwdK) * [Documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs) * [Legacy (v8) documentation](http://discordjs.readthedocs.io/en/8.2.0/docs_client.html) * [Examples](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js/tree/master/docs/examples) * [GitHub](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js) * [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) * [Related libraries](https://discordapi.com/unofficial/libs.html) ## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).

updating.name: Updating your code
updating.content:
# Version 10
Version 10's non-BC changes focus on cleaning up some inconsistencies that exist in previous versions.
Upgrading from v9 should be quick and painless.

## Client options
All client options have been converted to camelCase rather than snake_case, and `max_message_cache` was renamed to `messageCacheMaxSize`.

v9 code example:
```js
const client = new Discord.Client({
  disable_everyone: true,
  max_message_cache: 500,
  message_cache_lifetime: 120,
  message_sweep_interval: 60
});
```

v10 code example:
```js
const client = new Discord.Client({
  disableEveryone: true,
  messageCacheMaxSize: 500,
  messageCacheLifetime: 120,
  messageSweepInterval: 60
});
```

## Presences
Presences have been completely restructured.
Previous versions of discord.js assumed that users had the same presence amongst all guilds - with the introduction of sharding, however, this is no longer the case.

v9 discord.js code may look something like this:
```js
User.status; // the status of the user
User.game; // the game that the user is playing
ClientUser.setStatus(status, game, url); // set the new status for the user
```

v10 moves presences to GuildMember instances. For the sake of simplicity, though, User classes also expose presences.
When accessing a presence on a User object, it simply finds the first GuildMember for the user, and uses its presence.
Additionally, the introduction of the Presence class keeps all of the presence data organised.

**It is strongly recommended that you use a GuildMember's presence where available, rather than a User.
A user may have an entirely different presence between two different guilds.**

v10 code:
```js
MemberOrUser.presence.status; // the status of the member or user
MemberOrUser.presence.game; // the game that the member or user is playing
ClientUser.setStatus(status); // online, idle, dnd, offline
ClientUser.setGame(game, streamingURL); // a game
ClientUser.setPresence(fullPresence); // status and game combined
```

## Voice
Voice has been rewritten internally, but in a backwards-compatible manner.
There is only one breaking change here; the `disconnected` event was renamed to `disconnect`.
Several more events have been made available to a VoiceConnection, so see the documentation.

## Events
Many events have been renamed or had their arguments change.

### Client events
|    Version   9                                       |    Version   10                               |
|------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|
|    guildMemberAdd(guild, member)                     |    guildMemberAdd(member)                     |
|    guildMemberAvailable(guild, member)               |    guildMemberAvailable(member)               |
|    guildMemberRemove(guild, member)                  |    guildMemberRemove(member)                  |
|    guildMembersChunk(guild, members)                 |    guildMembersChunk(members)                 |
|    guildMemberUpdate(guild, oldMember, newMember)    |    guildMemberUpdate(oldMember, newMember)    |
|    guildRoleCreate(guild, role)                      |    roleCreate(role)                           |
|    guildRoleDelete(guild, role)                      |    roleDelete(role)                           |
|    guildRoleUpdate(guild, oldRole, newRole)          |    roleUpdate(oldRole, newRole)               |

The guild parameter that has been dropped from the guild-related events can still be derived using `member.guild` or `role.guild`.

### VoiceConnection events
| Version 9    | Version 10 |
|--------------|------------|
| disconnected | disconnect |

## Dates and timestamps
All dates/timestamps on the structures have been refactored to have a consistent naming scheme and availability.
All of them are named similarly to this:  
**Date:** `Message.createdAt`  
**Timestamp:** `Message.createdTimestamp`  
See the docs for each structure to see which date/timestamps are available on them.


# Version 9
The version 9 (v9) rewrite takes a much more object-oriented approach than previous versions,
which allows your code to be much more readable and manageable.
It's been rebuilt from the ground up and should be much more stable, fixing caching issues that affected
older versions. It also has support for newer Discord Features, such as emojis.

Version 9, while containing a sizable number of breaking changes, does not require much change in your code's logic -
most of the concepts are still the same, but loads of functions have been moved around.
The vast majority of methods you're used to using have been moved out of the Client class,
into other more relevant classes where they belong.
Because of this, you will need to convert most of your calls over to the new methods.

Here are a few examples of methods that have changed:
* `Client.sendMessage(channel, message)` ==> `TextChannel.sendMessage(message)`
  * `Client.sendMessage(user, message)` ==> `User.sendMessage(message)`
* `Client.updateMessage(message, "New content")` ==> `Message.edit("New Content")`
* `Client.getChannelLogs(channel, limit)` ==> `TextChannel.fetchMessages({options})`
* `Server.detailsOfUser(User)` ==> `Server.members.get(User).properties` (retrieving a member gives a GuildMember object)
* `Client.joinVoiceChannel(voicechannel)` => `VoiceChannel.join()`

A couple more important details:
* `Client.loginWithToken("token")` ==> `client.login("token")`
* `Client.servers.length` ==> `client.guilds.size` (all instances of `server` are now `guild`)

## No more callbacks!
Version 9 eschews callbacks in favour of Promises. This means all code relying on callbacks must be changed.  
For example, the following code:

```js
client.getChannelLogs(channel, 100, function(messages) {
  console.log(`${messages.length} messages found`);
});
```

```js
channel.fetchMessages({limit: 100}).then(messages => {
  console.log(`${messages.size} messages found`);
});
```

faq.name: FAQ
faq.content:
# Frequently Asked Questions
These are just questions that get asked frequently, that usually have a common resolution.
If you have issues not listed here, please ask in the [official Discord server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).
Always make sure to read the documentation.

## No matter what, I get `SyntaxError: Block-scoped declarations (let, const, function, class) not yet supported outside strict mode`â€½
Update to Node.js 6.0.0 or newer.

## How do I get voice working?
- Install FFMPEG.
- Install either the `node-opus` package or the `opusscript` package.
  node-opus is greatly preferred, due to it having significantly better performance.

## How do I install FFMPEG?
- **npm:** `npm install --save ffmpeg-binaries`
- **Ubuntu 16.04:** `sudo apt install ffmpeg`
- **Ubuntu 14.04:** `sudo apt-get install libav-tools`
- **Windows:** See the [FFMPEG section of AoDude's guide](https://github.com/bdistin/OhGodMusicBot/blob/master/README.md#download-ffmpeg).

## How do I set up node-opus?
- **Ubuntu:** Simply run `npm install node-opus`, and it's done. Congrats!
- **Windows:** Run `npm install --global --production windows-build-tools` in an admin command prompt or PowerShell.
  Then, running `npm install node-opus` in your bot's directory should successfully build it. Woo!

A collection of presences for friends of the logged in user.
<warn>This is only filled when using a user account.</warn>

props.description: The ClientUser representing the logged in Client

props.name: readyAt
props.description: The date at which the Client was regarded as being in the `READY` state.

props.name: pings
props.description: The previous heartbeat pings of the websocket (most recent first, limited to three elements)

props.name: status

props.description: The timestamp that the client was last ready at

props.name: browser
props.description: Whether the client is in a browser environment

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Logs the client in. If successful, resolves with the account's token. <warn>If you're making a bot, it's
much better to use a bot account rather than a user account.
Bot accounts have higher rate limits and have access to some features user accounts don't have. User bots
that are making a lot of API requests can even be banned.</warn>

params.name: token
params.description: The token used for the account.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the client and logs out.

methods.name: syncGuilds
methods.description:
This shouldn't really be necessary to most developers as it is automatically invoked every 30 seconds, however
if you wish to force a sync of guild data, you can use this.
<warn>This is only available when using a user account.</warn>

params.name: guilds
params.description: An array or collection of guilds to sync

methods.name: fetchUser
methods.description:
Caches a user, or obtains it from the cache if it's already cached.
<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the user to obtain

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Fetches an invite object from an invite code.

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetch a webhook by ID.

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description:
Sweeps all channels' messages and removes the ones older than the max message lifetime.
If the message has been edited, the time of the edit is used rather than the time of the original message.

params.name: lifetime
params.description:
Messages that are older than this (in seconds)
will be removed from the caches. The default is based on the client's `messageCacheLifetime` option.

returns.description:
Amount of messages that were removed from the caches,
or -1 if the message cache lifetime is unlimited

methods.name: fetchApplication
methods.description:
Gets the bot's OAuth2 application.
<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

methods.name: generateInvite
methods.description: Generate an invite link for your bot

params.name: permissions

methods.name: setInterval

params.name: delay
params.description: Time to wait before executing (in milliseconds)

methods.description: Clears an interval

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change.

events.name: guildUnavailable

events.name: emojiDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom guild emoji is deleted

events.name: emojiUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom guild emoji is updated

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left/been kicked from the guild.

events.name: roleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a role is created.

events.name: roleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

events.name: roleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

events.name: messageReactionAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is added to a message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that applied the emoji or reaction emoji.

events.name: messageReactionRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is removed from a message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the emoji or reaction emoji.

events.name: messageReactionRemoveAll
events.description: Emitted whenever all reactions are removed from a message.

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

events.name: userNoteUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a note is updated.

params.name: user
params.description: The user the note belongs to

params.name: oldNote
params.description: The note content before the update

params.name: newNote
params.description: The note content after the update

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted for general warnings

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a guild.

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is created.

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is deleted.

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever the pins of a channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event, not much information
can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occured in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the ban occurred in

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the unban occurred in

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is deleted/left.

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of guild members is received (all members come from the same guild)

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created

events.name: messageDelete

events.name: messageDeleteBulk

params.name: newMember

events.name: userUpdate

events.name: guildMemberAvailable

events.name: typingStart

props.name: queue
props.description: A list of requests that have yet to be processed.

props.name: globalLimit
props.description: Whether or not the client is being rate limited on every endpoint.

params.name: request

classes.name: SequentialRequestHandler
classes.description:
Handles API Requests sequentially, i.e. we wait until the current request is finished before moving onto
the next. This plays a _lot_ nicer in terms of avoiding 429's when there is more than one session of the account,
but it can be slower.

props.name: waiting
props.description: Whether this rate limiter is waiting for a response from a request

props.name: endpoint
props.description: The endpoint that this handler is handling

props.name: timeDifference
props.description:
The time difference between Discord's Dates and the local computer's Dates. A positive number means the local
computer's time is ahead of Discord's.

props.name: restManager
props.description: The RESTManager that instantiated this RequestHandler

props.name: queue
props.description: A list of requests that have yet to be processed.

props.name: globalLimit
props.description: Whether or not the client is being rate limited on every endpoint.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Performs a request then resolves a promise to indicate its readiness for a new request

methods.description: Push a new API request into this bucket

params.name: request
params.description: The new request to push into the queue

methods.name: handle
methods.description: Attempts to get this RequestHandler to process its current queue

classes.name: StreamDispatcher

props.name: passes
props.description:
How many passes the dispatcher should take when sending packets to reduce packet loss. Values over 5
aren't recommended, as it means you are using 5x more bandwidth. You _can_ edit this at runtime.

props.name: paused
props.description: Whether playing is paused

props.name: time
props.description: How long the stream dispatcher has been "speaking" for

props.name: totalStreamTime
props.description: The total time, taking into account pauses and skips, that the dispatcher has been streaming for

props.name: volume
props.description: The volume of the stream, relative to the stream's input volume

methods.name: setVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume relative to the input stream - i.e. 1 is normal, 0.5 is half, 2 is double.

params.name: volume
params.description: The volume that you want to set

methods.name: setVolumeDecibels
methods.description: Set the volume in decibels

methods.name: setVolumeLogarithmic
methods.description: Set the volume so that a perceived value of 0.5 is half the perceived volume etc.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Stops sending voice packets to the voice connection (stream may still progress however)

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes sending voice packets to the voice connection (may be further on in the stream than when paused)

methods.name: end
methods.description: Stops the current stream permanently and emits an `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: An optional reason for stopping the dispatcher.

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted when the dispatcher starts/stops speaking

params.name: value
params.description: Whether or not the dispatcher is speaking

events.name: start
events.description: Emitted once the dispatcher starts streaming

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted once the stream has ended. Attach a `once` listener to this.

params.name: reason
params.description:
The reason for the end of the dispatcher. If it ended because it reached the end of the
stream, this would be `stream`. If you invoke `.end()` without specifying a reason, this would be `user`.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted once the stream has encountered an error. Attach a `once` listener to this. Also emits `end`.

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted when the stream wants to give debug information.

props.name: voiceConnection
props.description: The voice connection the player belongs to

props.name: dispatcher

props.description: The VoiceConnection that instantiated this

methods.name: recreate
methods.description:
If this VoiceReceiver has been destroyed, running `recreate()` will recreate the listener.
This avoids you having to create a new receiver.
<info>Any streams that you had prior to destroying the receiver will not be recreated.</info>

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroy this VoiceReceiver, also ending any streams that it may be controlling.

methods.name: createOpusStream
methods.description:
Creates a readable stream for a user that provides opus data while the user is speaking. When the user
stops speaking, the stream is destroyed.

params.name: user

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>

classes.name: Guild
classes.description:
Represents a guild (or a server) on Discord.
<info>It's recommended to see if a guild is available before performing operations or reading data from it. You can
check this with `guild.available`.</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that created the instance of the the Guild.

props.name: members
props.description: A collection of members that are in this guild. The key is the member's ID, the value is the member.

props.name: channels
props.description: A collection of channels that are in this guild. The key is the channel's ID, the value is the channel.

props.name: roles
props.description: A collection of roles that are in this guild. The key is the role's ID, the value is the role.

props.name: presences
props.description: A collection of presences in this guild

props.name: available
props.description: Whether the guild is available to access. If it is not available, it indicates a server outage.

props.name: id
props.description: The Unique ID of the Guild, useful for comparisons.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the guild

props.name: icon
props.description: The hash of the guild icon, or null if there is no icon.

props.name: splash
props.description: The hash of the guild splash image, or null if no splash (VIP only)

props.name: region
props.description: The region the guild is located in

props.name: memberCount
props.description: The full amount of members in this guild as of `READY`

props.name: large
props.description: Whether the guild is "large" (has more than 250 members)

props.name: features
props.description: An array of guild features.

props.name: applicationID
props.description: The ID of the application that created this guild (if applicable)

props.name: emojis
props.description: A collection of emojis that are in this guild. The key is the emoji's ID, the value is the emoji.

props.name: afkTimeout
props.description: The time in seconds before a user is counted as "away from keyboard".

props.name: afkChannelID
props.description: The ID of the voice channel where AFK members are moved.

props.name: embedEnabled
props.description: Whether embedded images are enabled on this guild.

props.name: verificationLevel
props.description: The verification level of the guild.

props.name: joinedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the client user joined the guild at

props.name: ownerID
props.description: The user ID of this guild's owner.

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the guild was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the guild was created

props.name: joinedAt
props.description: The time the client user joined the guild

props.name: iconURL
props.description: Gets the URL to this guild's icon (if it has one, otherwise it returns null)

props.name: splashURL
props.description: Gets the URL to this guild's splash (if it has one, otherwise it returns null)

props.name: owner
props.description: The owner of the guild

props.name: voiceConnection
props.description: If the client is connected to any voice channel in this guild, this will be the relevant VoiceConnection.

props.name: defaultChannel
props.description: The `#general` GuildChannel of the server.

methods.name: setup
methods.description: Sets up the Guild

params.name: data
params.description: The raw data of the guild

methods.name: member
methods.description: Returns the GuildMember form of a User object, if the user is present in the guild.
examples:
// get the guild member of a user
const member = guild.member(message.author);

params.name: user
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the GuildMember of

methods.name: fetchBans
methods.description: Fetch a collection of banned users in this guild.

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetch a collection of invites to this guild. Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetch all webhooks for the guild.

methods.name: fetchMember
methods.description: Fetch a single guild member from a user.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to fetch the member for

methods.name: fetchMembers
methods.description:
Fetches all the members in the guild, even if they are offline. If the guild has less than 250 members,
this should not be necessary.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query to provide when fetching members

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the Guild with new information - e.g. a new name.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the guild with

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edit the name of the guild.

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the guild

methods.name: setRegion
methods.description: Edit the region of the guild.

params.name: region
params.description: The new region of the guild.

methods.name: setVerificationLevel
methods.description: Edit the verification level of the guild.

params.name: verificationLevel
params.description: The new verification level of the guild

methods.name: setAFKChannel
methods.description: Edit the AFK channel of the guild.

methods.name: setAFKTimeout
methods.description: Edit the AFK timeout of the guild.

params.name: afkTimeout
params.description: The time in seconds that a user must be idle to be considered AFK

methods.name: setIcon
methods.description: Set a new guild icon.

params.name: icon
params.description: The new icon of the guild

methods.name: setOwner
methods.description: Sets a new owner of the guild.

params.name: owner
params.description: The new owner of the guild

methods.name: setSplash
methods.description: Set a new guild splash screen.

params.name: splash
params.description: The new splash screen of the guild

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.
examples:
// ban a user
guild.ban('123123123123');

params.name: deleteDays
params.description:
The amount of days worth of messages from this user that should
also be deleted. Between `0` and `7`.

returns.description:
Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user ID will be the result.

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a user from the guild.

methods.name: pruneMembers
methods.description: Prunes members from the guild based on how long they have been inactive.

params.name: days
params.description: Number of days of inactivity required to kick

params.name: dry
params.description: If true, will return number of users that will be kicked, without actually doing it

returns.description: The number of members that were/will be kicked

methods.name: sync
methods.description:
Syncs this guild (already done automatically every 30 seconds).
<warn>This is only available when using a user account.</warn>

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Creates a new channel in the guild.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new channel

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the new channel, either `text` or `voice`

params.name: overwrites
params.description: Permission overwrites to apply to the new channel

methods.name: createRole
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild, and optionally updates it with the given information.
examples:
// create a new role with data
guild.createRole({ name: 'Super Cool People' })
  .then(role => console.log(`Created role ${role}`))
  .catch(console.error)

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the role with

methods.name: createEmoji
methods.description: Creates a new custom emoji in the guild.

methods.name: deleteEmoji
methods.description: Delete an emoji.

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Causes the Client to leave the guild.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Causes the Client to delete the guild.

methods.name: setRolePosition
methods.description: Set the position of a role in this guild

params.name: role
params.description: the role to edit, can be a role object or a role ID.

params.name: position
params.description: the new position of the role

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Whether this Guild equals another Guild. It compares all properties, so for most operations
it is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is often
what most users need.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the guild's name instead of the Guild object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from My Guild!

// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ' + guild + '!');

Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permission

// delete the channel

classes.name: Message
classes.description: Represents a message on Discord

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that instantiated the Message

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that the message was sent in

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the message (unique in the channel it was sent)

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the message

props.description: The content of the message

props.description:
Represents the author of the message as a guild member. Only available if the message comes from a guild
where the author is still a member.

props.name: pinned
props.description: Whether or not this message is pinned

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

props.name: nonce
props.description: A random number used for checking message delivery

props.name: system
props.description: Whether or not this message was sent by Discord, not actually a user (e.g. pin notifications)

props.name: embeds
props.description: A list of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player

props.name: attachments
props.description: A collection of attachments in the message - e.g. Pictures - mapped by their ID.

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was sent at

props.name: editedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: mentions
props.description: An object containing a further users, roles or channels collections

props.name: mentions.users
props.description: Mentioned users, maps their ID to the user object.

props.name: mentions.roles
props.description: Mentioned roles, maps their ID to the role object.

props.name: mentions.channels
props.description:
Mentioned channels,
maps their ID to the channel object.

props.name: mentions.everyone
props.description: Whether or not @everyone was mentioned.

props.name: reactions
props.description: A collection of reactions to this message, mapped by the reaction "id".

props.name: webhookID
props.description: ID of the webhook that sent the message, if applicable

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the message was sent

props.name: editedAt
props.description: The time the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the message was sent in (if in a guild channel)

props.name: cleanContent
props.description:
The message contents with all mentions replaced by the equivalent text. If mentions cannot be resolved to a name,
the relevant mention in the message content will not be converted.

props.name: edits
props.description:
An array of cached versions of the message, including the current version.
Sorted from latest (first) to oldest (last).

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether the message is editable by the client user.

props.name: deletable
props.description: Whether the message is deletable by the client user.

props.name: pinnable
props.description: Whether the message is pinnable by the client user.

methods.name: isMentioned
methods.description: Whether or not a user, channel or role is mentioned in this message.

params.name: data
params.description:
either a guild channel, user or a role object, or a string representing
the ID of any of these.

methods.name: isMemberMentioned
methods.description:
Whether or not a guild member is mentioned in this message. Takes into account
user mentions, role mentions, and @everyone/@here mentions.

params.name: member
params.description: Member/user to check for a mention of

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edit the content of the message

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: editCode
methods.description: Edit the content of the message, with a code block

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: react
methods.description: Add a reaction to the message

methods.name: clearReactions
methods.description: Remove all reactions from a message

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long to wait to delete the message in milliseconds

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Reply to the message

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetches the webhook used to create this message.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the message's content instead of the object.
examples:
// logs: Message: This is a message!

props.name: collected
props.description: A collection of collected messages, mapped by message ID.

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves when a valid message is sent. Rejects
with collected messages if the Collector ends before receiving a message.

methods.name: verify
methods.description: Verifies a message against the filter and options

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the collector and emits `end`.

params.name: reason
params.description: An optional reason for stopping the collector

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever the collector receives a message that passes the filter test.

params.name: collector
params.description: The collector the message passed through

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the Collector stops collecting.

params.name: collection
params.description:
A collection of messages collected
during the lifetime of the collector, mapped by the ID of the messages.

params.name: reason
params.description:
The reason for the end of the collector. If it ended because it reached the specified time
limit, this would be `time`. If you invoke `.stop()` without specifying a reason, this would be `user`. If it
ended because it reached its message limit, it will be `limit`.

methods.description:
Whether this role equals another role. It compares all properties, so for most operations

<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

params.description: ID of the message to get

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.

methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this channel and returns a collection of them.

methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

params.description: The new position for the guild channel

params.name: name
params.description: Optional name for the new channel, otherwise it has the name of this channel

params.name: withPermissions
params.description: Whether to clone the channel with this channel's permission overwrites

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the channel's mention instead of the Channel object.

classes.name: Collection
classes.description:
A Map with additional utility methods. This is used throughout discord.js rather than Arrays for anything that has
an ID, for significantly improved performance and ease-of-use.

props.name: _array
props.description: Cached array for the `array()` method - will be reset to `null` whenever `set()` or `delete()` are called.

props.name: _keyArray
props.description: Cached array for the `keyArray()` method - will be reset to `null` whenever `set()` or `delete()` are called.

methods.name: array
methods.description:
Creates an ordered array of the values of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be
reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you change the length of the array
itself. If you don't want this caching behaviour, use `Array.from(collection.values())` instead.

methods.name: keyArray
methods.description:
Creates an ordered array of the keys of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be
reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you change the length of the array
itself. If you don't want this caching behaviour, use `Array.from(collection.keys())` instead.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Obtains the first item in this collection.

methods.name: firstKey
methods.description: Obtains the first key in this collection.

methods.name: last
methods.description:
Obtains the last item in this collection. This relies on the `array()` method, and thus the caching mechanism
applies here as well.

methods.name: lastKey
methods.description:
Obtains the last key in this collection. This relies on the `keyArray()` method, and thus the caching mechanism
applies here as well.

methods.name: random
methods.description:
Obtains a random item from this collection. This relies on the `array()` method, and thus the caching mechanism
applies here as well.

methods.name: randomKey
methods.description:
Obtains a random key from this collection. This relies on the `keyArray()` method, and thus the caching mechanism
applies here as well.

methods.name: findAll
methods.description:
Searches for all items where their specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`).
examples: collection.findAll('username', 'Bob');

methods.name: find
methods.description:
Searches for a single item where its specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`), or the given function returns a truthy value. In the latter case, this is identical to
[Array.find()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find).
<warn>Do not use this to obtain an item by its ID. Instead, use `collection.get(id)`. See
[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/get) for details.</warn>
examples: collection.find('username', 'Bob');
collection.find(val => val.username === 'Bob');

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: findKey
methods.description:
Searches for the key of a single item where its specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`), or the given function returns a truthy value. In the latter case, this is identical to
[Array.findIndex()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/findIndex).
examples: collection.findKey('username', 'Bob');
collection.findKey(val => val.username === 'Bob');

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: exists
methods.description:
Searches for the existence of a single item where its specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`).
<warn>Do not use this to check for an item by its ID. Instead, use `collection.has(id)`. See
[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/has) for details.</warn>

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),
but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: filterArray
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: map
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.map()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: some
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.some()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/some).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: every
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.every()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/every).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: reduce
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.reduce()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/reduce).

params.name: fn
params.description:
Function used to reduce, taking four arguments; `accumulator`, `currentValue`, `currentKey`,
and `collection`

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection. None of the source collections are modified.
examples: const newColl = someColl.concat(someOtherColl, anotherColl, ohBoyAColl);

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description: Calls the `delete()` method on all items that have it.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this collection shares identical key-value pairings with another.
This is different to checking for equality using equal-signs, because
the collections may be different objects, but contain the same data.

returns.description: Whether the collections have identical contents

interfaces.name: TextBasedChannel
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that have text-channel-like features

props.name: messages
props.description: A collection containing the messages sent to this channel.

props.name: lastMessageID
props.description: The ID of the last message in the channel, if one was sent.

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel.

props.name: typingCount
props.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

methods.name: sendEmbed
methods.description: Send an embed to this channel

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: name
params.description: Name and extension of the file

methods.name: sendCode
methods.description: Send a code block to this channel

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description:
Gets a single message from this channel, regardless of it being cached or not.
<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

params.name: messageID
params.description: ID of the message to get

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this channel and returns a collection of them.

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createCollector but in promise form. Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified
filter.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description:
Bulk delete given messages.
<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

params.name: messages
params.description: Messages to delete, or number of messages to delete

typedefs.name: UserResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a User object. This can be:
* A User object
* A user ID
* A Message object (resolves to the message author)
* A Guild object (owner of the guild)
* A GuildMember object

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:
* A Guild object
* A Guild ID

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:
* A GuildMember object
* A User object

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Channel. This can be:
* A Channel object
* A Message object (the channel the message was sent in)
* A Guild object (the #general channel)
* A channel ID

typedefs.name: InviteResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give an invite code. This can be:
* An invite code
* An invite URL

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:
* A string
* A permission number

Possible strings:
```js
[
  "CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE",
  "KICK_MEMBERS",
  "BAN_MEMBERS",
  "ADMINISTRATOR",
  "MANAGE_CHANNELS",
  "MANAGE_GUILD",
  "ADD_REACTIONS", // add reactions to messages
  "READ_MESSAGES",
  "SEND_MESSAGES",
  "SEND_TTS_MESSAGES",
  "MANAGE_MESSAGES",
  "EMBED_LINKS",
  "ATTACH_FILES",
  "READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY",
  "MENTION_EVERYONE",
  "EXTERNAL_EMOJIS", // use external emojis
  "CONNECT", // connect to voice
  "SPEAK", // speak on voice
  "MUTE_MEMBERS", // globally mute members on voice
  "DEAFEN_MEMBERS", // globally deafen members on voice
  "MOVE_MEMBERS", // move member's voice channels
  "USE_VAD", // use voice activity detection
  "CHANGE_NICKNAME",
  "MANAGE_NICKNAMES", // change nicknames of others
  "MANAGE_ROLES_OR_PERMISSIONS",
  "MANAGE_WEBHOOKS",
  "MANAGE_EMOJIS"
]
```

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a string. This can be:
* A string
* An array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)
* Any value

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:
* A Buffer
* A base64 string

typedefs.name: BufferResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:
* A Buffer
* The path to a local file
* A URL

typedefs.name: EmojiIdentifierResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give an emoji identifier. This can be:
* A string
* An Emoji
* A ReactionEmoji

typedefs.name: MessageOptions

props.name: nonce
props.description: The nonce for the message

props.name: embed
props.description:
An embed for the message
(see [here](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object) for more details)

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description:
Whether or not @everyone and @here
should be replaced with plain-text

props.name: file
props.description: A file to send with the message

props.name: code
props.description: Language for optional codeblock formatting to apply

props.name: split
props.description:
Whether or not the message should be split into multiple messages if
it exceeds the character limit. If an object is provided, these are the options for splitting the message.

typedefs.name: SplitOptions

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximum character length per message piece

props.name: char
props.description: Character to split the message with

props.name: prepend
props.description: Text to prepend to every piece except the first

props.name: append
props.description: Text to append to every piece except the last

typedefs.name: ChannelLogsQueryOptions
typedefs.description:
The parameters to pass in when requesting previous messages from a channel. `around`, `before` and
`after` are mutually exclusive. All the parameters are optional.

props.name: limit
props.description: Number of messages to acquire

props.name: before
props.description: ID of a message to get the messages that were posted before it

props.name: after
props.description: ID of a message to get the messages that were posted after it

props.name: around
props.description: ID of a message to get the messages that were posted around it

typedefs.name: AwaitMessagesOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing the same properties as CollectorOptions, but a few more:

props.name: errors
props.description: Stop/end reasons that cause the promise to reject

typedefs.name: MessageEditOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into editMessage

props.name: embed
props.description: An embed to be added/edited

props.name: code
props.description: Language for optional codeblock formatting to apply

typedefs.name: CollectorFilterFunction
CollectorOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing options used to configure a MessageCollector. All properties are optional.

props.name: time
props.description: Duration for the collector in milliseconds

props.name: max
props.description: Maximum number of messages to handle

props.name: maxMatches
props.description: Maximum number of successfully filtered messages to obtain

typedefs.name: RoleData
typedefs.description: The data for a role

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the role

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the role, either a hex string or a base 10 number

props.name: hoist
props.description: Whether or not the role should be hoisted

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the role

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions of the role

props.name: mentionable
props.description: Whether or not the role should be mentionable

typedefs.name: WebhookMessageOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into sendMessage, sendTTSMessage, sendFile, sendCode

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message should be spoken aloud

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description:
Whether or not @everyone and @here
should be replaced with plain-text

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description: Options for a Client.

props.name: apiRequestMethod
props.description:
'sequential' or 'burst'. Sequential executes all requests in
the order they are triggered, whereas burst runs multiple at a time, and doesn't guarantee a particular order.

props.name: shardId
props.description: The ID of this shard

props.name: shardCount
props.description: The number of shards

props.name: messageCacheMaxSize
props.description:
Maximum number of messages to cache per channel
(-1 or Infinity for unlimited - don't do this without message sweeping, otherwise memory usage will climb
indefinitely)

props.name: messageCacheLifetime
props.description:
How long until a message should be uncached by the message sweeping
(in seconds, 0 for forever)

props.name: messageSweepInterval
props.description:
How frequently to remove messages from the cache that are older than
the message cache lifetime (in seconds, 0 for never)

props.name: fetchAllMembers
props.description:
Whether to cache all guild members and users upon startup, as well as
upon joining a guild

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description: Default value for MessageOptions.disableEveryone

props.name: sync
props.description: Whether to periodically sync guilds (for userbots)

props.name: restWsBridgeTimeout
props.description:
Maximum time permitted between REST responses and their
corresponding websocket events

props.name: restTimeOffset
props.description:
The extra time in millseconds to wait before continuing to make REST
requests (higher values will reduce rate-limiting errors on bad connections)

props.name: disabledEvents
props.description:
An array of disabled websocket events. Events in this array will not be
processed, potentially resulting in performance improvements for larger bots. Only disable events you are
100% certain you don't need, as many are important, but not obviously so. The safest one to disable with the
most impact is typically `TYPING_START`.

props.name: ws
props.description: Options for the websocket

typedefs.name: WebsocketOptions
typedefs.description: Websocket options. These are left as snake_case to match the API.

props.name: large_threshold
props.description: Number of members in a guild to be considered large

props.name: compress
props.description:
Whether to compress data sent on the connection.
Defaults to `false` for browsers.

typedefs.name: WSEventType
typedefs.description:
The type of a websocket message event, e.g. `MESSAGE_CREATE`. Here are the available events:
- READY
- GUILD_SYNC
- GUILD_CREATE
- GUILD_DELETE
- GUILD_UPDATE
- GUILD_MEMBER_ADD
- GUILD_MEMBER_REMOVE
- GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE
- GUILD_MEMBERS_CHUNK
- GUILD_ROLE_CREATE
- GUILD_ROLE_DELETE
- GUILD_ROLE_UPDATE
- GUILD_BAN_ADD
- GUILD_BAN_REMOVE
- CHANNEL_CREATE
- CHANNEL_DELETE
- CHANNEL_UPDATE
- CHANNEL_PINS_UPDATE
- MESSAGE_CREATE
- MESSAGE_DELETE
- MESSAGE_UPDATE
- MESSAGE_DELETE_BULK
- MESSAGE_REACTION_ADD
- MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE
- MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_ALL
- USER_UPDATE
- USER_NOTE_UPDATE
- PRESENCE_UPDATE
- VOICE_STATE_UPDATE
- TYPING_START
- VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE
- RELATIONSHIP_ADD
- RELATIONSHIP_REMOVE
